abstract: In a preliminary settlement agreement, Pfizer tries to address lawsuits accusing its board and top officials of failing to stop illegal marketing of its drugs.
snippet: In a preliminary settlement agreement, Pfizer tries to address lawsuits accusing its board and top officials of failing to stop illegal marketing of its drugs.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer has agreed to set up a $75 million fund and to create a new compliance committee to settle shareholders’ lawsuits accusing the board and top officials of failing to stop illegal marketing of its drugs, according to a settlement agreement filed in United States District Court on Friday.

headline.main: Pfizer Plans $75 Million Fund to Address Shareholder Suits
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Plans $75 Million Fund To Address Shareholder Suits
